alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 13 at 3:37AM HST until January 14 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large, reinforcing northwest swell will cause surf to increase later today along most north and west facing shores of the islands. Surf may approach the High Surf Warning criteria along north and west facing shores of Kauai County, and possibly Oahu, later today. This elevated surf is expected to persist along most north and west facing shores of the smaller islands from tonight through early Friday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Along north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and Maui, surf will rise to 18 to 24 feet this afternoon. Along west facing shores of Niihau and Kauai, surf will rise to 14 to 18 feet this afternoon, and along west facing shores of Oahu and Molokai, surf will rise to 12 to 16 feet this afternoon. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Kauai, Niihau, Oahu, and Molokai, and for north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
